headline: Biden's New Press Secretary Had Some Interesting Things to Say About Fox News
author: Leah Barkoukis
sentences:
"Fox News was racist before #coronavirus, they are racist during coronavirus, and Fox News will be racist after the coronavirus" @JoyAnnReid #AMJoy #MSNBC #SundayMorning pic.twitter.com/0oOQWqkSE8
 Karine Jean-Pierre (@K_JeanPierre) March 15, 2020
Stolen emails, stolen drone, stolen election .....welcome to the world of #unpresidented Trump https://t.co/NI7vqPV6cu
 Karine Jean-Pierre (@K_JeanPierre) December 18, 2016
Reminder: Brian Kemp stole the gubernatorial election from Georgians and Stacey Abrams.https://t.co/ZIKGTd6U1v
 Karine Jean-Pierre (@K_JeanPierre) April 2, 2020
As Guy stated, all this coming from the administration that promised to unite the country.

Bidens new Press Secretary:
- 2018 GA gubernatorial election was stolen
- 2016 presidential election was stolen
- AIPAC is racist
- Fox News is racist
Good stuff from the person who will speak on behalf of a president who vowed to heal & restore our nations soul!

And, you have their own viewers who can now, the ones who are 60 and older who are watching, this is a health crisis that were in, this is a global pandemic, as the WHO have said, and theyre putting their lives in dangers."

In addition to declaring Brian Kemp stole the gubernatorial election from Georgians and Stacey Abrams,? and that 2016 was stolen as well, she also has a history of slapping the racist label on groups of people.

Source: Photo by Evan Agostini/Invision/AP
As Matt detailed on Tuesday, critics are digging up plenty of dirt on White House Press Secretary Jen Psakis replacement, Karine Jean-Pierre.

Here's what she said on the panel:
"[Fox News] was racist before coronavirus, they are racist during the coronavirus, Fox News will be racist after the coronavirus.
I think the difference is they are all-in on being state TV for Donald Trump, and so they will continue to give the misinformation," she said.
In 2019, she thought Democrats should skip a meeting with the American Israel Public Affairs Committee, believing it was "severely racist."
Then, in 2020, the Democrat shared a clip of her appearance on "AM Joy," stating that Fox News is "racist."
"The danger is, so yes, you have Asian Americans right now whose lives are seriously in danger.
At the time of writing, Jean-Pierre hasn't deleted any of her controversial tweets.
So there is nothing new here.
